abstract: Republican legislators in several states are proposing bills that would prevent issuing marriage licenses to gay couples, even as federal courts declare same-sex marriage bans to be unconstitutional; introduction of state bills, which are unlikely to pass, hint at larger battle that may continue regardless of whether Supreme Court eventually decides that same-sex marriage should be legal nationwide.
lead_paragraph: Despite rulings declaring bans on same-sex marriage unconstitutional in their states, some state legislators have introduced bills that would prohibit the issuing of marriage licenses to gay couples.

byline.contributor: Richard Fausset reported from Columbia, and Alan Blinder from Atlanta.
byline.original: By RICHARD FAUSSET and ALAN BLINDER

snippet: Despite rulings declaring bans on same-sex marriage unconstitutional in their states, some state legislators have introduced bills that would prohibit the issuing of marriage licenses to gay couples.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: States Renew Fight to Stop Same-Sex Marriage
headline.print_headline: States Renew Fight to Stop Gay Marriage
